stimulusHtml: An object is initially at the origin. The object changes its position to the right by 4 units. The object then changes its position to the left by 3 units. Which of the following correctly indicates the magnitude of the objectâ€™s change in position and provides a valid justification?
choicesHtml: 1 unit, because in one dimension vectors with opposite directions have opposite signs.
1 unit, because the magnitude of the difference of two vectors is always equal to the difference between the magnitudes of the vectors.
7 units, because the magnitude of the sum of two vectors is always equal to the sum of the magnitudes of the vectors.
7 units, because the object moves a distance of 4 units followed by a distance of 3 units.
